content: is there such a thing as  L-system to create bespoke furniture (cf CityEngine...)?

Yes, it is possible to use L-systems (Lindenmayer systems) to generate designs for bespoke furniture. L-systems are a formal grammar that can be used to represent and generate complex patterns and shapes. They have been widely used in computer graphics and procedural generation to create various structures, including furniture designs.

By defining the rules and parameters of an L-system, one can iteratively generate patterns and shapes that can be used in the creation of furniture designs. Depending on the specific requirements and constraints, L-systems can be used to generate intricate details, repeated patterns, or even full furniture designs by combining multiple L-system-generated elements.

Tools like CityEngine, which are primarily used for procedural modeling of urban environments, can also be utilized to generate furniture designs by using L-systems or similar algorithms. These tools can offer a range of parametric controls and procedural rules to generate furniture designs from scratch or based on specific input parameters.

In summary, L-systems, along with tools like CityEngine, can be employed to create bespoke furniture designs by leveraging the power of procedural generation and parametric modeling.
